holidays.name: Chocolate Mint Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the delicious combination of rich chocolate and refreshing mint flavors.
holidays.origin: Chocolate and mint flavors have been paired together since the early 1900s in candies and desserts. This day was created by fans of this iconic combo to enjoy all things chocolate mint.
holidays.funFact: Did you know the famous York Peppermint Pattie was first made in 1940 and helped popularize chocolate mint as a classic flavor pairing?

holidays.name: National Tug-of-War Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the classic game of tug-of-war, where strength and teamwork collide in a test of pulling power!
holidays.origin: Tug-of-war dates back thousands of years as a contest of strength in many cultures. This day honors the fun and competitive spirit of the game.
holidays.funFact: Tug-of-war was actually once an Olympic event from 1900 to 1920!

holidays.name: Love Your Pet Day
holidays.description: A heartwarming day to shower your furry, feathery, or scaly friends with extra love, treats, and cuddles.
holidays.origin: Started by pet lovers as a way to appreciate the joy and companionship pets bring into our lives.
holidays.funFact: Pets have been shown to reduce stress and increase happiness, so loving your pet is good for your health too!

holidays.name: Dance Romance Day
holidays.description: A whimsical day meant to inspire couples to express their love through dance, from ballroom to hip-hop!
holidays.origin: Created as a quirky counterpart to Valentine’s Day, encouraging romantic connection through movement and rhythm.
holidays.funFact: Dancing together releases oxytocin, the ‘love hormone,’ making this a scientifically supported romantic activity!
